pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:0.5: 6. The training rule on exchanging what belongs to the Sangha
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.2: At that time the lay followers collected voluntary contributions to supply the Sangha of nuns with robes. They stored the requisites in a cloth merchant’s shop, and then went to the nuns and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.3: “Venerables, requisites to be used for robes are stored in such-and-such a cloth merchant’s shop. Please have someone get cloth from that and share it out.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.4: But the nuns exchanged those requisites for tonics, which they then used.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.5: When the lay followers found out about this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.6: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.7: The nuns heard the complaints of those lay followers,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.8: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.9: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.13: “When requisites belonging to the Sangha are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.15: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:1.16.1: ‘When a requisite belonging to the Sangha is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.5: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.6: it was given for a specific purpose.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.8: belonging to the Sangha, not to a group, not to an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.10: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.11: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.12: It is to be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.13: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.14: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.1.15: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a requisite belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.1: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.2: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.3: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.4: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.5: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.6: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.2.7: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.3: if she uses it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np6:2.3.6: The sixth training rule is finished.
